channel.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
channel.description:
I recently downloaded Ddsspeced v3 source and tested it with my friend, he hosted it and I connected. When I clicked the tutorial island guide, I got BSoD. I rebooted, thinking it was an error, and tried again. Same thing.
Whats wrong here?

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Soo, your talking about this?

My old computer had that problem. Wanna know how I fixed it? Re-did the computer with a clean slate of Windows.

P.S - If you say you know as much as you do, you wouldn’t be asking for help about it, simple as that.

Read full topic
item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“Thrasher Alpha, post:3, topic:347176”][quote author=supernovarsps link=topic=443553.msg3256936#msg3256936 date=1278189626]
maby a virus did u scan it?
[/quote]
I highly doubt you know anything, and get a new computer, yours is probably shit.
You dont know anything about viruses. I know all about java botnets, rats, other things, and it isnt. It was a legit source, from Jaden. You just cant get a virus from playing a runescape server (unless the client had one in it).

This is an issue with the server itself.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Thrasher Alpha link=topic=443553.msg3257348#msg3257348 date=1278218174]

I didn’t mean using a virus scanner on them.
I meant litterally scanning through it.
(Opening it up and skimming the lines)

If you knew what you were doing, and which lines.

Im not quite sure, actually. You dont need the .java files, you just need the .class. The .java files are for only if you want to edit the java program, and if you are trying to spread a virus, I wouldnt include my source.
[/quote]
I know the difference between Java and Class files.
A simple fix though, would be to hide the virus/Java bot in the java files,
compile in it to the class files, then remove the bot from the java, and then release it.

And the only way to remove it would be compiling before you ran the server,
but adding an anti-leech could stop that.[/quote]

Java bots exist, and although Im not sure on which files they use (Ive only use .exe’s as of now), Im sure its hard as fuck.

Read full topic

item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]But if you think about it.
All the people that understand how dangerous Java/other scripted bots, would be careful to check what they are running before they run a server/client.

I know about 80% of my friends check the run.bat/compile.bat before they use it as they could attempting to run a malicious file.

Though, hiding in/among the class files would be alot more effective, as NOBODY would scan each single class/java file to see if it has anything pertaining to Java bots.[/quote]

Ive never had a virus scanner in years, and my computer is just fine. You know why? I know what programs I run.

Of course I would be skeptical of someone saying “here, test my java program!”. But with a person like Jayden who has developed a reputation over the years, you dont need to worry.

And you CANT scan a java file (you can, but it wont do you any good). AV’s dont pick then up (yet).

Read full topic
item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Thrasher Alpha link=topic=443553.msg3257206#msg3257206 date=1278206947]
The way java bots work, they use jars to execute the bot because a .jar can do more than one task at once.

Anyways, I got the problem worked out, I updated my drivers. Im still not sure what caused the problem, but Im glad its over.
[/quote]
How can a JAR execute more tasks than a simple class file?
If you code it correctly, you could add a simple Java bot inside one class, or you could use a complex java bot with little parts in each of the server’s classes.

Once the server initiates, it will string together each piece of the bot, doing what you told it to do.

I know about Java, so this is possible.[/quote]

The jar itself contains the files of the bot, carefully coded to be less detectable (kind of edgy, you know what I mean, a good coder would know how to sort of hide it), and the jar runs whatever it needs. It can run the bot itself (however the bot wants to run and what it does), and it can also run as whatever it was said to do.

Read full topic
item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

The way java bots work, they use jars to execute the bot because a .jar can do more than one task at once.

Anyways, I got the problem worked out, I updated my drivers. Im still not sure what caused the problem, but Im glad its over.

Read full topic
item.source: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Thrasher Alpha link=topic=443553.msg3257033#msg3257033 date=1278195612]

Did I say anything about it being a virus or a java bot? NO.
So stop bringing up that option on every single reply.

I said there was a possibility that there was malware encrypted in the cache.
Try replacing that.

Also, check the main server classes.

Lastly, I never said get a new source, so stop being a prick, and learn to read.
TRY ANOTHER SOURCE TO SEE IF ITS THE SAME PROBLEM.

And, BSoD does fuck your registry, so try repairing it.

And I said java bot, because thats the only kind of virus that it could me. Since there are only Java files that I am opening (ex, .jar), it has to be a java bot. You could tell it to open an .exe, but there isnt an exe anywhere in the client folder. By all that and all of the coding, it has to be a java bot.

Also if you want to get correct about viruses they can store EVERYWHERE! and also

to me if you go Blue Screen Of Death

go re sync ya heatpaste and stop it over heating other than that get a new computer.

noob dont come here because you and your computer suck

go buy a quad core computer noob

Alienware, M17x. Do you want to call that a sucky computer?

you have an alienware pc and your playing fucking runescape …

yeah right kid stop using google now.

go re sync ya heatpaste see what happens after that.

I dont tell you what to use your PC for.

Go try to download the source and client, and see if you get a BSoD too. This will tell us if its just me getting the error, or if its for both of us.

Ill be back in a few hours.
[/quote]
A Jar is Java Archive, try extracting the jar to see whats in it?[/quote]

The jar just contains themes.

Read full topic

I have no idea why you’re getting the BSOD, I haven’t planted anything in my client that would cause it. I suggest you update your drivers, etc.

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Thrasher Alpha link=topic=443553.msg3257025#msg3257025 date=1278195111]

No but the fact still stands your computer has a virus … try a virus scanner

Avg
Nod32
Malwarebytes anti-malware

its all the same lol get scanning them come back

My. Computer. Does. Not. Have. A. Virus.

Do you KNOW how Viruses work? Do you know where they plant themselves? Do you know why hackers do it? Do you know how to locate where they are? Do you know what they look like in task manager? Do you know how STUPID a virus is if all it did was BSoD when you do a certain thing on a certain server?

No, you do not.

The server itself has some faulty coding, requesting something and getting itself in some sort of bug error, and instead of disconnecting me from the server, its an error that affects my client and generates an error that gives me a BSoD. It can happen with ANY program.

I know what Im talking about. Please stop posting if your going to keep insisting I have a virus. This isnt a hacking forum. I know what Im talking about, and I know what Im doing.

Please get someone in here who can actually help me instead of saying “lul get a new sauce” or “rofl u gots a virus”.
[/quote]
If you know what you’re doing, why are you asking for help?[/quote]

Please refrain from stupid questions, but you may have misunderstood me. I was talking about the virus, and my computer. Not the server. I do know what Im talking about, and Im just asking you to help me with the BSoD. If you wont even download the source to see if it happens to you, then I dont know what kind of helping you are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Did I say anything about it being a virus or a java bot? NO.
So stop bringing up that option on every single reply.

I said there was a possibility that there was malware encrypted in the cache.
Try replacing that.

Also, check the main server classes.

Lastly, I never said get a new source, so stop being a prick, and learn to read.
TRY ANOTHER SOURCE TO SEE IF ITS THE SAME PROBLEM.

And, BSoD does fuck your registry, so try repairing it.[/quote]

I was not the one running the server at the time, my friend was on a different computer. I connected with one client, and it gave me BSoD. I tried with a different client, same result. BSoD. Check my reply to Scape-JAVA below.

Scape-JAVA:

It may not be from the server it could be from something else. and no shit sherlock. it’s obviously in c;/drive.

I stated the only other thing that it could be, which is the client. It happens on multiple clients, which brings that option out of the question, which means that it had to be with the server coding itself.

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“Joker^, post:10, topic:347176”]No but the fact still stands your computer has a virus … try a virus scanner

Avg
Nod32
Malwarebytes anti-malware

its all the same lol get scanning them come back :)[/quote]

My. Computer. Does. Not. Have. A. Virus.

Do you KNOW how Viruses work? Do you know where they plant themselves? Do you know why hackers do it? Do you know how to locate where they are? Do you know what they look like in task manager? Do you know how STUPID a virus is if all it did was BSoD when you do a certain thing on a certain server?

No, you do not.

The server itself has some faulty coding, requesting something and getting itself in some sort of bug error, and instead of disconnecting me from the server, its an error that affects my client and generates an error that gives me a BSoD. It can happen with ANY program.

I know what Im talking about. Please stop posting if your going to keep insisting I have a virus. This isnt a hacking forum. I know what Im talking about, and I know what Im doing.

Please get someone in here who can actually help me instead of saying “lul get a new sauce” or “rofl u gots a virus”.

item.title: BSoD (Blue Screen) when I click on a certain NPC
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I’d rather not test anything that gives BSoD.

If you want to fuck your registry, and destroy your computer, then go ahead.

But as I said, try another source, not use one.

See if its the source itself, or if its all DDSpeced.

Btw, it’s Jayden, not Jaden. :P[/quote]

Have you ever worked with viruses, better yet java bots before? I didnt think so. This is NOT a virus. The only reason I would tell you to download, is that I seem to be the only one having the problem. The resaon I tell you to test is to that you can see what Im talking about. Dont tell me that the source is going to give me a virus if you havnt even worked with one of that nature, I know what Im talking about.

If your not even going to help me with my problem and continue to push it aside, saying just to get a new source, then stop trying to help me. Im looking for people who actually know things, and know how to work with problems instead of giving up and getting a new source that works.

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:8, topic:347176”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=443553.msg3257001#msg3257001 date=1278194187]
Btw, it’s Jayden, not Jaden.
[/quote]

Jayden is to sexy to do such a thing.

I think it’s a virus in your c;/drive I have the same thing going on with my computer.[/quote]

C:\ drive. Thats where ALL viruses go. It only blue screens when I click on the certain NPC.

And if it were a virus, I would of noticed the activity by now.

You cant get a damn virus by playing a server, its IMPOSSIBLE. You can get a virus from the client, and I checked the run code for the client. Its perfectly clean.

Read full topic
